result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda L Rosnostik was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with 15CF205 and all other cases.

miscConds.notes:
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Comply with all conditions set forth in 15CF205.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Amanda L Rosnostik in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Arendt. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 15CF205, 15CF217

  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF205 Count 1 - GUILTY
15CF217 Count 1 - GUILTY

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Court questions Atty Cousins re: restitution requests. 

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CF205, 15CF217.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Arendt makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 
Court questions the defendant. 

BY THE COURT:
15CF205 - 
Sentence withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 48 months: 
No contact with co-defendants - Luke Aitken, Liza Carlson and Brandon Castaneda. 
No contact with Walmart in Plover or Target in Stevens Point. 
Provide proof of AODA completion and comply with all treatment recommendations.
Work fulltime, go to school fulltime or a combination thereof. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
All prescriptions from 1 pharmarcy and sign all necessary releases of information. 
Pay restitution of $634.85 to Target. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Submit a DNA sample if not already done so. 

15CF217 - 
Sentence withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 48 months, concurrent with 15CF205 and all other cases:
Comply with all conditions set forth in 15CF205. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 

Court advises of post-conviction relief.
$5,000 sig bond cover 15CF205 and 15CF217: No contact with Target and Walmart in Plover. No Luke Aitken and  Liza Carlson.

Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Arraignment:
  State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

Defendant Amanda L Rosnostik in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Arendt. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case 15CF205 and 15CF217.
Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading on both cases.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant does not appear.  Attorney Patrick Thomas Arendt in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 15CF205, 15CF217

2:24 p.m.  Court calls the cases. 
Atty Arendt addresses the Court with re: to his clients non-appearance.  Neither he, nor the defendant have received a copy of the complaint.  Defendant has moved since the complaint was mailed to the incorrect address.  Asks to continue to 7/27/15 to allow the defendant time. 
Atty Constable does not object. 

  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Prior: 1228 Prospect Ave, Wausau, WI 54403
